reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Having played this a week or so prerelease, I have to say this early access version has improved this experience no end, it's a really immersive sailing feeling now.

With the free to play price, I can't really complain, it's quite relaxing if you ignore the race, and quite fun if you are into yacht racing, however the textures and models are pretty mismatched and it could do with a bit more content (I really want to throw in a line and fish - or have some islands to sail around in relaxation mode) if it wants to be taken seriously.

At the moment it is a fine free experience, and well worth a try, but has real potential if kept updated in the future.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\na good little sailing sim, this has a ton of potential.  I made a three minute review here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-PhQK8re-4&feature=youtu.be

Early Access Review

I like sailing, and I love the idea of a VR sailing game. I mean, it could be an issue with motion sickness for some people, but it's a cool idea.

This is pre-alpha though. Don't expect anything else. But I can see it could form into something pretty cool! It needs lots of work first though.

Observations:
-Boats have no momentum and will turn on the spot. Makes tacking weird, where you don't need to gather speed before making a tack, nor does carrying speed seem to help.
-No way of knowing the direction of the wind, no gusts (dark patches on water, arrows over water, etc)
-I rammed someone while on Port and didn't need to do a 360/720 (BONUS!), this is a feature.
-The guy I rammed proceeded to push my boat underwater with his epic downwind power, like an asshat.
-No mainsheet/jibsheet, but fair enough for simplicities sake.
-Switch of hands with tiller doesnt work.
-Downwind/running is like 5 times faster than upwind, should be 0.2 to 2 depending on how much of a bathtub you're sailing.
-Reaching is slower than running.
-Hmm, actually, change the last 2 points for no apparent wind mechanic.

Regardless, I appreciate the free content, and wish you well on your development!

Early Access Review

Please note: At the point of writing this, this is day one of early access of this game (and it shows).

The potential here is fantastic but a lot of work needs to be done.  The premise is simple. You sail a dingy. You can race or sail in a relaxing manner. The mechanics work well if not overly realistic (water is rarely that smooth). However the simplisic graphics (and whales floating above the water) let the game down. Much better visuals would do a lot for the game (especially in relaxing mode).

If the game remains as is" then it's great proof of concept idea. VR sailing could work well with the right styles and enviroments. If however the devs keep working on the game then you've set up some intersting foundations for what could be a very interesting VR game .

"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Nice proof of concept. It is quite relaxing.

I can't tell if this game makes me sea sick or vr sick.  Something about the way you are gliding over the water unsettles me.  If there were actual waves causing an up and down motion I would surely vomit within the first 2 minutes.

I would recommend this game to people who enjoy sailing because the maneuvering seems logical, I don't know if it is accurate because I've never been in an actual sail boat, and there is definitely a strategy to this game though I have struggled to figure it out.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI don't want to click 'No' because it's free and there's no reason not to try it. It's not unpleasant. It just feels like it was thrown together in an afternoon and there's really not much at all to it. It has flying whales though, so if you're into flying whales, it's a must have.

Early Access Review\n\nThere's a bit learning curve and the graphics might not be optimized to the position of controller but if you get used to these, it's actually a pretty neat free game for both relaxing and challenges.
